resources.string:
Select the number of keys you wish to generate and tap Begin.

Then tap and swipe wildly around the screen. As you create random data the progress bar will fill.

Once complete your contact should use Add to scan the QR codes generated. Once complete both phones will be in sync.

Tap Begin.

Then tap and swipe wildly around the screen. As you create random data the progress bar will fill.

Once complete your contact should use Add to scan the QR codes generated. Once complete both phones will be in sync.
Before you can send or receive encrypted messages you must setup a set of keys to use.
Type your full message here then hit Next. You will be redirected to your normal sms handler to send the message.

The Keystore is where all of the keys used to encrypt/decrypt messages to/from contacts are stored. To keep this file secure you should setup a password for it. The default location for this file is on internal memory. You can change this in Key Management.\n\nIf you do not wish to use a password simply leave the box blank (Not Recommended).
If you need to send a message and you want to make sure that only your recipient can read it.
If you want to send a message and you want to make sure that only your recipient knows a secret message exists.
In order to unlock the Keystore you must supply the password.
